<@U02CS2Q38QG> ask and you shall receive!

Everything is built using module fields, so everything that's on the website can be edited from the page designer.

I make heavy use of repeated field groups to iterate over things like features, pricing tiers, logos, etc. so you basically create a collection of objects within the module.

Each template is made up of around 3 sections, and each section is made up of around 3 to 5 modules.

Each module is inserted in its own DnD row to allow for padding and margin adjustment on the fly.

The only thing that I don't make use of are side by side DnD columns because I find them hard to create responsive designs with. With Tailwind it's easy.

The idea of breaking things down like this is that creating a new page from scratch will only take you adding 3 sections, or you can mix and match sections however you want. Sections have default layouts, paddings, etc. so marketers don't have to fiddle with settings and can write copy ASAP.
<@U02CS2Q38QG> If you want I can share some of the code with you :slightly_smiling_face: Whatever you need to get your own website up, I'm happy to help.
I was also able to use SWR to load data from a third-party serverless function that I used as a proxy to hide the environment secrets.
